newsitem.title: SUDAN: Sudan's Bashir says wants good relations with West.
newsitem.headline: Sudan's Bashir says wants good relations with West.

text.p: Sudanese President Omar Hassan al-Bashir said on Monday his country wanted to improve its relations with western countries as long as they did not interfere in Sudan's internal affairs.
Bashir said in a speech to the third session of Sudan's parliament that he wanted to maintain contacts with the United States so the two countries could resolve their differences.
The United States says Sudan is one of several countries that sponsor international terrorism. Sudan denies the charge.
"We would like to stress that Islam, our faith, forbids us from resorting to violence, aggression or terrorism," Bashir said.
He said Sudan wanted to base its relations with the West on the principles that "we respect their choice and they respect our own choice".

A United States decision to provide non-lethal military aid to Eritrea, Uganda and Ethiopia has angered Sudan, which accused them of assisting anti-Khartoum rebels, a charge the three African countries deny.
The U.S. has an embassy in Khartoum but its ambassador resides in Nairobi.
